column4: what should i learn if i want to start developing programs with gui's for ubuntu?
What is your programming background?
] grimm[, haha, not much, html like the back of my hand mostly, some php here and there...
I'm not sure what you're trying to write, but in my experience, python and glade is not that bad
] grimm[, im not sure either, haha. im just wondering where would be a good place to start...
Is ubuntu against easybuntu?
Right, nothing is really going to be easy with no programming background, but I felt like that was comparatively easier to learn than other possibilities.
] grimm[, well im going to be taking some classes soon that will hopefully get me books etc on the stuff

You'd probably want to hit Guido's python tutorial to get a feel for how python works, then try some pyglade tutorials to get the fundamentals of gui programming with python.  It shouldn't be too hard to start with an easy project like a graphical calculator.
] grimm[, what's the site? or can i just google guido's
http://docs.python.org/tut/
] grimm[, haha, nvm .... http://www.python.org/~guido/ .?
] grimm[, what program should i use to start programming? like to do editing and stuff....
I'd just start with the python cli
Gedit will give you python syntax highlighting
] grimm[, k nice

I've mostly just used something like gedit and the command line for coding and debugging in python, but I haven't really written much substantial.  I've tried Eric, it's fairly advanced IDE for python, but it's QT based and I felt like it was a bit cluttered.  It had a fairly decent Visual Studio-like debugging functions when I last tried it, and I'd imagine it's gotten a bit better now.
http://www.die-offenbachs.de/eric/index.html
] grimm[, can i get it from the repo'
s
They've got eric3 in the repos
you mean like virtual hosts?
] grimm[, thanks
anytime
